result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy J. Pumplun was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
case called at 8:48am. [MK]
Defendant Timothy J. Pumplun in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Pumplun waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
Service of Information admitted, reading waived; the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (ADA Beck submits the victim impact statement); the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Pumplun guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Pumplun on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as required by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of any non-prescribed controlled substances
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to submit to random drug and alcohol screens as required by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as directed by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

Days credit for time already served:  2 days
The Court sets the restitution amount at $0 zero.
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings are given. 
recess 9:07am.
Status conference on November 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Timothy J. Pumplun
Current: 102 N. High St., Fort Atkinson, WI 53538 United States  (Effective: 10-02-2014)
Prior: 700 N. High St., Apt 102, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

Case called at 1:15 pm
Defendant Timothy J. Pumplun in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews conflict review worksheet, Court in it's former compacity as Jefferson County District Attorney was assigned to a previous case in 2004. Court concludes there is no reason to recuse or disqualify itself.
Court verifies with the Defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charge and maximum penalties recited
Court finds that the criminal complaint state probable cause to support Count #1.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $10,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-Not to possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No contact with Nona Zblewski or Tony Pumplun
-No presence at Nona Zblewski's residence
-Defendant may return on one occasion  with law enforcement to return to the residence he most recently occupied to obtain his personal belongings (as an excpetion to the no contact and no presence)

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Recess: 1:24 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 10/22/14 at 10:00 am
Status: to be set
